title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)
text: parameters used example based Bringmann et al. (2013).

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)
text: Let t=1000t = 1000 number time points n=1000n = 1000 number individuals. Let measurement model intecept vector ð›Ž\boldsymbol{\nu} given ð›Ž=(00).\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\nu} = \left( \begin{array}{c}   0 \\   0 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation} Let factor loadings matrix ðš²\boldsymbol{\Lambda} given ðš²=(1001).\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Lambda} = \left( \begin{array}{cc}   1 & 0 \\   0 & 1 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation} Let measurement error covariance matrix ðš¯\boldsymbol{\Theta} given ðš¯=(0.2000.2).\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Theta} = \left( \begin{array}{cc}   0.2 & 0 \\   0 & 0.2 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation} Let initial condition ð›ˆ0\boldsymbol{\eta}_{0} given ð›ˆ0âˆ¼ð’©(ð›ð›ˆâˆ£0,ðšºð›ˆâˆ£0)\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\eta}_{0} \sim \mathcal{N} \left( \boldsymbol{\mu}_{\boldsymbol{\eta} \mid 0}, \boldsymbol{\Sigma}_{\boldsymbol{\eta} \mid 0} \right) \end{equation} ð›ð›ˆâˆ£0=(00)\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\mu}_{\boldsymbol{\eta} \mid 0} = \left( \begin{array}{c}   0 \\   0 \\ \end{array} \right) \end{equation} ðšºð›ˆâˆ£0=(1001).\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Sigma}_{\boldsymbol{\eta} \mid 0} = \left( \begin{array}{cc}   1 & 0 \\   0 & 1 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation} Let transition matrix ð›ƒ\boldsymbol{\beta} given (0.28âˆ’0.048âˆ’0.0350.26).\begin{equation} \left( \begin{array}{cc}   0.28 & -0.048 \\   -0.035 & 0.26 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation} Let dynamic process noise ðš¿\boldsymbol{\Psi} given ðš¿=(1.30.56963150.56963151.56).\begin{equation} \boldsymbol{\Psi} = \left( \begin{array}{cc}   1.3 & 0.5696315 \\   0.5696315 & 1.56 \\ \end{array} \right) . \end{equation}

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)

what: Using the SimSSMFixed Function from the simStateSpace Package to Simulate Data
title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)
code: library(simStateSpace) sim <- SimSSMFixed(   n = n,   time = time,   mu0 = mu0,   sigma0_l = sigma0_l,   alpha = alpha,   beta = beta,   psi_l = psi_l,   nu = nu,   lambda = lambda,   theta_l = theta_l ) data <- as.data.frame(sim) head(data) #>   id time         y1         y2 #> 1  1    0 -0.2826487 -0.4032862 #> 2  1    1  4.7613668  0.1714329 #> 3  1    2  4.1256231  1.4049857 #> 4  1    3  4.8376927  2.6579244 #> 5  1    4  2.3087179  0.2121804 #> 6  1    5  3.3357857  1.9931660 plot(sim)

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)
text: DTVAR function fits DT-VAR model individual ii using byid = TRUE argument. model type specified using model argument.
code: library(fitDTVARMx) fit <- DTVAR(   data = data,   observed = paste0("y", seq_len(k)),   id = "id",   model = 5,   byid = TRUE,   ncores = parallel::detectCores() )

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Fixed-Effect Model)
text: MetaVARMx function performs multivariate meta-analysis using estimated parameters corresponding sampling variance-covariance matrix individual ii. Estimates prefix b0 correspond estimates beta alpha.

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Mixed-Effects Model)
code: library(simStateSpace) sim <- SimSSMIVary(   n = n,   time = time,   mu0 = mu0,   sigma0_l = sigma0_l,   alpha = alpha,   beta = beta,   psi_l = psi_l,   nu = nu,   lambda = lambda,   theta_l = theta_l ) data <- as.data.frame(sim) head(data) #>   id time         y1        y2 #> 1  1    0 -0.6563714 0.7844723 #> 2  1    1  2.8349968 3.7454156 #> 3  1    2  2.4472952 4.8793152 #> 4  1    3  2.0347478 5.4189059 #> 5  1    4  2.0042842 5.2184013 #> 6  1    5  1.6750301 2.8175884 plot(sim)

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Mixed-Effects Model)
text: DTVAR function fits DT-VAR model individual ii using byid = TRUE argument. model type specified using model argument.
code: library(fitDTVARMx) fit <- DTVAR(   data = data,   observed = paste0("y", seq_len(k)),   id = "id",   model = 5,   byid = TRUE,   ncores = parallel::detectCores() ) #> Warning in parallel::mclapply(X = ids, FUN = fit, data = data, id = id, : #> scheduled cores 13, 18, 6, 24, 9, 8, 5, 16, 17, 12, 19, 23, 21, 4, 1, 10, 11, #> 3, 14, 7, 20, 15, 22 encountered errors in user code, all values of the jobs #> will be affected

title: Multivariate Meta-Analysis of Discrete-Time VAR Estimates (Mixed-Effects Model)
text: MetaVARMx function performs multivariate meta-analysis using estimated parameters corresponding sampling variance-covariance matrix individual ii. Estimates prefix b0 correspond estimates beta_mu alpha_mu. Estimates prefix b1 correspond estimates effects x y. Note effects x y case zeros. Estimates prefix t2 correspond estimates beta_sigma alpha_sigma. Estimates prefix i2 correspond estimates heterogeniety.
code: x <- lapply(   X = seq_len(n),   FUN = function(i) {     stats::rnorm(n = 2)   } ) library(metaVAR) meta <- MetaVARMx(   object = fit,   x = x,   intercept = TRUE,   ncores = parallel::detectCores() ) #> Error in object$coefficients: $ operator is invalid for atomic vectors summary(meta) #> Error: object 'meta' not found

title: Fit Multivariate Meta-Analysis â€” MetaVARMx
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

title: Fit Multivariate Meta-Analysis â€” MetaVARMx
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Generate data using the simStateSpace package------------------------------ beta_mu <- matrix(   data = c(     0.7, 0.5, -0.1,     0.0, 0.6, 0.4,     0, 0, 0.5   ),   nrow = 3 ) beta_sigma <- diag(3 * 3) beta <- simStateSpace::SimBetaN(   n = 5,   beta = beta_mu,   vcov_beta_vec_l = t(chol(beta_sigma)) ) sim <- simStateSpace::SimSSMVARIVary(   n = 5,   time = 100,   mu0 = list(rep(x = 0, times = 3)),   sigma0_l = list(t(chol(diag(3)))),   alpha = list(rep(x = 0, times = 3)),   beta = beta,   psi_l = list(t(chol(diag(3)))) ) data <- as.data.frame(sim)  # Fit the model-------------------------------------------------------------- library(fitDTVARMx) fit <- FitDTVARIDMx(   data = data,   observed = c("y1", "y2", "y3"),   id = "id" )  # Multivariate meta-analysis------------------------------------------------- library(metaVAR) meta <- MetaVARMx(fit) print(meta) summary(meta) coef(meta) vcov(meta) } # }
